intro: Hieracium sublaeve, commonly known as the smooth hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered with fine, soft hairs. Its basal leaves are broadly ovate to heart-shaped, while the upper leaves are more lanceolate. The flowers are yellow and bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
